    Team News

    Juventus
    • Kwadwo Asamoah, Paul Pogba, Martin Caceres and Romulo remain sidelined for the Italian side.
    • Fernando Llorente started the recent 1-0 win at Sampdoria that sealed the title for Juventus, though he is expected to drop out in place of Alvaro Morata.
    • Giorgio Chiellini is also likely to feature from the off alongside Leonardo Bonucci at the heart of the defence.
    Real Madrid
    • Marcelo returns from suspension and will likely start at left-back for the European champions.
    • With Luka Modric sidelined, Sergio Ramos could be used in midfield again, as has been the case of late.
    • Karim Benzema also misses out through injury, which could see Cristiano Ronaldo spearhead the attack and Javier Hernandez drop to the bench.

    Prediction

    • To some, Juventus are the weakest side remaining in the Champions League, but the Italian champions are a difficult team to face on their day. They will pose a threat to Real Madrid as they look to make home advantage count in their first leg meeting with Los Blancos.
    • Real Madrid looked suspect at the back in their weekend win over Sevilla. Nevertheless, the reigning European champions secured a crucial 3 points and they are likely to take the confidence gained from the victory in Seville to Turin.
    • Juventus are not to be underestimated here and while they may have floundered of late, the hosts have what it takes to secure a narrow victory on home turf.
    Prediction:
    Juventus
    2
    1
    Real Madrid

    • [ - ] Turan - member since 22-Nov-13

      Real Madrid have improved on the problem they had conceding goals from set pieces. Wins against Atletico and Sevilla have boosted morale and the return of Bale adds another dimension to the front line. Ramos in midfield has proven to be a relatively good choice in the absence of Modric as he provides anticipation, good one touch passing and superior aerial ability though he is not as effective as Modric in carrying the ball forward. Varane's speed might be pivotal in marking Tevez and the presence of Pepe,Varane,Ramos,Ronaldo and Bale ensures there are at least 5 players capable of clearing the ball in defensive set pieces or scoring a goal in aerial offensive positions. James has been giving a show since his return and has proven why he was bought. Marcelo has been below par defending lately but against Juventus who will most likely be solid at the back, his presence may ensure more creativity going forward. Once more it will be about who takes their chances,Madrid will have more.

    • [ - ] Turan - member since 22-Nov-13

      Juventus are a solid Italian team, that won the Serie A for the 4th consecutive time. They haven't participated in the latter stages of the Champions League as much as they would like to so they will be coming into this game with hunger. They have the absence of Pogba but the likes of Tevez,Vidal,Pirlo,Chiellini and Buffon are quality players with character. So far their results indicate that they got the job done but perhaps without imposing (except the 0-3 in Dortmund). They are strong defending set pieces and Tevez is a menace with the ball at his feet and free space ahead of him. They will try to have posession of the ball but primarily will try not to leave spaces and gaps. Real Madrid's defence should be aware of Pirlo's ability to start counters and curl the ball behind the defence line as well as any fouls outside the box are gifts for his terrific set piece taking.
